docs.snippet: Scores of survivors have testified in the trial of James E. Holmes, but jurors have not heard from many others whose lives were changed by the 2012 attack....
docs.lead_paragraph: Scores of survivors have testified in the trial of James E. Holmes, but jurors have not heard from many others whose lives were changed by the 2012 attack.
docs.abstract: Toll on victims following 2012 shooting in Aurora, Colo, offers glimpse into difficulties survivors and their families face after traumatic event; challenges range from physical and mental trauma to related financial problems and anxieties around testifying.

headline.main: Full Toll From Aurora Theater Shooting Goes Untold at Trial
headline.print_headline: Human Toll in Colorado Theater Shooting Goes Beyond the Testimony

docs.snippet: The Fanatics, a group of nearly 30 green-and-gold-clad Australian fans, are a relentless and polarizing presence in professional tennis....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Fanatics, a group of nearly 30 green-and-gold-clad Australian fans, are a relentless and polarizing presence in professional tennis.
docs.abstract: Christopher Clarey On Tennis column notes that group of nearly 30 cheerfully rowdy Australian fans, known as the Fanatics, are making their presence felt for first time at Wimbledon--long an ode to silence and restraint.

headline.main: Invigorating or Infuriating, and Definitely Indiscreet
headline.print_headline: Invigorating or Infuriating, and Definitely Indiscreet

docs.snippet: A team of gay African-American men who practice a balletic version of cheerleading called J-setting have been ejected from parades, but celebrated, too....
docs.lead_paragraph: A team of gay African-American men who practice a balletic version of cheerleading called J-setting have been ejected from parades, but celebrated, too.
docs.abstract: Prancing Elites, team of gay African-American men from Mobile, Ala, who practice balletic version of cheerleading called J-setting, say finding acceptance in the south is sometimes hard, but add that a lot has changed in last few years; group now has its own television series, The Prancing Elites Project and recently performed at Gay Pride Parade in New York City.

headline.main: The Prancing Elites Dance Their Way Up
